title: So it's ok for Lee to rush a longsword and become a dueling god?
body: It's just a longsword, and that's all he needs to outdamage pretty much any champ he runs into.  Lets not forget he can also outrun anyone in the game under just about any circumstance.  How is this alright?  I'm really tired of Lee dominating and making other jungle picks not viable, hasn't he been like this long enough?

Lee Sin takes skill to learn, but when you learn him, he's pretty untouchable, which makes him difficult to handle. All of the other junglers with escapes (like Elise) have their escapes nerfed in the name of "balance." Elise's Cocoon and Rappel have been getting consistently nerfed, yet Lee Sin, who can practically move in, kill, then escape in one rotation won't get touched. It becomes a glaring problem when the balance team refuses to touch a champion but consistently nerf nearly all the others just because he's popular. Sure, some will lament balance changes, but if the changes are subtle and not an overall change to how he plays, then it's not so much a big deal.
As a side note, I often wonder how popular he actually is. Since he has been left to run rampant and win so much, you have to question if he is truly liked or merely a side effect of bloated stats/kit that make him OP and thus desirable by those seeking an easy win.
Yeah, champ popularity is almost entirely decided based on strength anyway.  Lee's been a favorite for a long time because he's been at the top of the heap for a long time.  Variety is good :)

Lee is considered god tier in LCS... and absolutely nowhere else (rightly, at least). He's not bad by any stretch of the imagination, but I don't think I've seen him banned a single time above silver (and that was probably me, not wanting a silver Lee on the team).

Yeah, Lee has been consistently strong for a long time, but he's never really been a problem in the same way WW and Rammus were recently. So have a bunch of junglers though (Vi, Fiddles, Jarvan), the boards just complain about Lee because he's so prominent in LCS (which I won't comment on because LCS is pretty much a whole different game so idgaf). And even if he has always been the top jungler, we all know this game is too complicated for Riot to control it perfectly, so I'd just say that it's a good decision by them to leave him like that and not risk his spot being taken by WW or Mumu or something much less interesting to play against.
